title: StrongLifts 5x5 program
description: Popular beginner-intermediate strength training program. Three workouts per week focusing on compound lifts with progressive overload.
effectiveness_rationale: Systematic reviews show progressive overload programs increase strength by 20-40% in 12 weeks for beginners. Over 1 million users worldwide with documented results. Based on established periodization principles.

title: Starting Strength by Mark Rippetoe
description: Comprehensive book and training program on barbell strength training. Covers proper form and programming for main compound lifts.
effectiveness_rationale: Widely considered the gold standard for strength training fundamentals. Program has been used by thousands of coaches and athletes. Studies show proper form reduces injury risk by 50-70%.

title: Creatine monohydrate
description: Most researched sports supplement. Increases ATP production for improved strength, power, and muscle endurance during training.
effectiveness_rationale: Over 500 studies show 5-15% strength gains and 10-25% power improvements. International Society of Sports Nutrition calls it the most effective supplement for high-intensity exercise. 70% of users respond positively.

title: Personal trainer for strength
description: Certified strength and conditioning specialist who designs periodized programs and ensures proper lifting technique to prevent injury.
effectiveness_rationale: Studies show trained individuals working with coaches achieve 30-50% better strength gains than solo training. Form correction reduces injury risk significantly. Accountability increases training consistency.

title: JEFIT app
description: Workout tracking app with exercise database, progress charts, and pre-built strength programs. Helps ensure progressive overload over time.
effectiveness_rationale: Systematic tracking improves training adherence by 40-60%. Over 10 million users. Research shows tracking leads to faster strength gains through better program compliance and data-driven adjustments.

title: Optimum Nutrition Gold Standard Whey
description: Popular whey protein powder providing 24g protein per serving. Helps meet daily protein needs for muscle recovery and growth.
effectiveness_rationale: Meta-analysis shows adequate protein intake (1.6-2.2g/kg) combined with resistance training increases strength gains by 10-20%. Whey protein improves recovery when consumed post-workout.

title: Progressive overload training log
description: Systematic recording of every workout to ensure you're consistently adding weight, reps, or sets over time. Core principle of strength building.
effectiveness_rationale: Progressive overload is the fundamental principle of strength training supported by decades of research. Tracking ensures consistent application. Studies show logged workouts lead to 25-40% better results.

title: Caffeine pre-workout
description: Caffeine taken 30-60 minutes before training to enhance focus, reduce perceived exertion, and improve power output.
effectiveness_rationale: Meta-analysis of 40+ studies shows caffeine increases strength performance by 3-8%. Optimal dose is 3-6mg per kg body weight. One of the most evidence-backed ergogenic aids.

title: Barbell Medicine coaching
description: Evidence-based online strength coaching by physician-lifters. Personalized programming based on autoregulation and scientific principles.
effectiveness_rationale: Founded by medical doctors who are competitive powerlifters. Programs based on current sports science research. Client data shows average 15-30% strength gains in 12 weeks with proper programming.

title: Sleep 7-9 hours nightly
description: Consistent adequate sleep for optimal recovery, hormone production, and central nervous system readiness for heavy lifting.
effectiveness_rationale: Studies show sleep deprivation reduces strength performance by 10-30%. Growth hormone secretion peaks during deep sleep. Athletes sleeping 7-9 hours show significantly better training adaptations and injury resistance.
